title: Alberto Costa chooses constituency Christmas card | Leicester Mercury
text:
Comments (0) 
South Leicestershire MP Alberto Costa, below, has picked his 2016 constituency Christmas card, thanks to sponsorship from Calor Gas. 
Primary schools in his area were encouraged to hold their own competitions, with the winning drawings sent in for consideration. 
The winning design, pictured, came from five-year-old Laura Green, of the Old Mill Primary School, in Broughton Astley. 
Two runner-up drawings – which will go on the back of his card – came from Poppy James, 10, of St Mary's CE Primary School, Bitteswell and Lottie Worral, nine, of Millfield L.E.A.D Academy, in Braunstone Town. 
Read more: 'Talks on Brexit vital if we are to prosper' 
Paul Blacklock, head of strategy and corporate affairs for Calor Gas, said: "Our largest operational site in the UK is in Stoney Stanton in Leicestershire, so we were delighted to be approached by Mr Costa to join them in the Christmas card competition. 
"We are always looking for ways to engage with the local community and stakeholders such as schools, so this was an ideal way to give something back." 
Mr Costa said: "I am grateful to all school children who entered the competition, and to Calor Gas for their generous sponsorship. 
"I look forward to running the competition again next year and seeing the excellent drawings produced in 2017."
